alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin; Lyon; Morris; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Franklin, southern Morris, southeastern Shawnee, southern Douglas, southeastern Wabaunsee, Osage and northern Lyon Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 1259 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles south of Berryton to near Allen to near Burdick. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Topeka, Emporia, Ottawa, Baldwin City, Osage City, Council Grove, Carbondale, Richland, Wellsville, Auburn, Overbrook, Lyndon, Centropolis, Burlingame, Americus, Pomona, Scranton, Quenemo, Melvern and Lone Star. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 128 and 134, and between mile markers 191 and 198. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 125 and 170. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Douglas; Franklin; Lyon; Morris; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
